forms.comment: This form will register a new case.

This form will update a case that has already been registered.  
While editing your form you can refer to or use existing case properties that have been saved in other forms.  
You can also save them as new case properties or update existing case properties by using the "Case Management" tab above.
This form will allow you to close or update a previously registered case.

_attachments.44ba1079fa15c3f72386506a2ac179e395d972ee:
<h:html xmlns:h="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:orx="http://openrosa.org/jr/xforms" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2002/xforms" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:jr="http://openrosa.org/javarosa" xmlns:vellum="http://commcarehq.org/xforms/vellum">
	<h:head>
		<h:title>Visit</h:title>
		<model>
			<instance>
				<data xmlns:jrm="http://dev.commcarehq.org/jr/xforms" xmlns="http://openrosa.org/formdesigner/52D111C9-79C6-403F-BF4C-D24B64A872E2" uiVersion="1" version="1" name="Visit">
					<welcome_message/>
					<sample_case_logic/>
					<sample_choice_question/>
					<sample_number_question/>
				</data>
			</instance>
			<instance src="jr://instance/casedb" id="casedb"/>
			<instance src="jr://instance/session" id="commcaresession"/>
			<bind nodeset="/data/welcome_message"/>
			<bind nodeset="/data/sample_case_logic" type="xsd:string" relevant="instance('casedb')/casedb/case[@case_id = instance('commcaresession')/session/data/case_id]/sample_choice_question = "choice1""/>
			<bind nodeset="/data/sample_choice_question"/>
			<bind nodeset="/data/sample_number_question" type="xsd:int"/>
			<itext>
				<translation lang="en" default="">
					<text id="welcome_message-label">
						<value>This is a **follow up form**.  It will collect additional or updated information about a previously registered case.  You can then save this information to the case as **case properties**, reference previously collected data, or update properties (ex.  child's weight).

* Case properties that were saved in the "Registration" form have automatically been loaded for use in this form.
* To reference answers from the previous form, you can drag on of the case properties from the "CASE PROPERTIES" window in order to manage display and validation logic based on previously created case properties that have been saved. In this example, the first "Text" question will only display if the case property "sample_choice_question" had been answered with "choice1" in the Registration form.
* To setup how the list of cases will look on the phone, choose the Follow Up module, and then select which case properties you want to display in the list and detail screens ([Help Site Info on Case List and Detail Screens](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Case+List+and+Case+Detail+Configuration))
* You can add text, number, multiple choice or other question types to this form.
* For multiple choice questions, use the circle button in the toolbar to add more choices.
* On the main form page, you can choose which of these questions you want to *save to the case* as case properties.

For more help, see the following Help Site Pages:

* [CommCare Forms](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Form+Builder)
* [Case Management Overview](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Case+Management).
* [Application Building Tutorials](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Application+Building+Tutorial+Series)

When you're ready to test your application, you can use the Try In CloudCare option on the form settings page, or [install it on a phone using our deploy manager](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Deploy+an+Application+on+CommCareHQ).</value>
						<value form="markdown">This is a **follow up form**.  It will collect additional or updated information about a previously registered case.  You can then save this information to the case as **case properties**, reference previously collected data, or update properties (ex. child's weight).

* Case properties that were saved in the "Registration" form have automatically been loaded for use in this form.
* To reference answers from the previous form, you can drag on of the case properties from the "CASE PROPERTIES" window in order to manage display and validation logic based on previously created case properties that have been saved. In this example, the first "Text" question will only display if the case property "sample_choice_question" had been answered with "choice1" in the Registration form.
* To setup how the list of cases will look on the phone, choose the Follow Up module, and then select which case properties you want to display in the list and detail screens ([Help Site Info on Case List and Detail Screens](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Case+List+and+Case+Detail+Configuration))
* You can add text, number, multiple choice or other question types to this form.
* For multiple choice questions, use the circle button in the toolbar to add more choices.
* On the main form page, you can choose which of these questions you want to *save to the case* as case properties.

For more help, see the following Help Site Pages:

* [CommCare Forms](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Form+Builder)
* [Case Management Overview](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Case+Management).
* [Application Building Tutorials](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Application+Building+Tutorial+Series)

When you're ready to test your application, you can use the Try In CloudCare option on the form settings page, or [install it on a phone using our deploy manager](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Deploy+an+Application+on+CommCareHQ).</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_case_logic-label">
						<value>Question Requiring Case Property Display Logic</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_choice_question-label">
						<value>Sample Choice Question</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_choice_question-choice1-label">
						<value>Choice 1</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_choice_question-choice2-label">
						<value>Choice 2</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_choice_question-choice3-label">
						<value>Choice 3</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_number_question-label">
						<value>Sample Number Question</value>
					</text>
				</translation>
			</itext>
		</model>
	</h:head>
	<h:body>
		<trigger ref="/data/welcome_message" appearance="minimal">
			<label ref="jr:itext('welcome_message-label')"/>
		</trigger>
		<input ref="/data/sample_case_logic">
			<label ref="jr:itext('sample_case_logic-label')"/>
		</input>
		<select1 ref="/data/sample_choice_question">
			<label ref="jr:itext('sample_choice_question-label')"/>
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('sample_choice_question-choice1-label')"/>
				<value>choice1</value>
			</item>
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('sample_choice_question-choice2-label')"/>
				<value>choice2</value>
			</item>
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('sample_choice_question-choice3-label')"/>
				<value>choice3</value>
			</item>
		</select1>
		<input ref="/data/sample_number_question">
			<label ref="jr:itext('sample_number_question-label')"/>
		</input>
	</h:body>
</h:html>
<h:html xmlns:h="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:orx="http://openrosa.org/jr/xforms" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2002/xforms" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:jr="http://openrosa.org/javarosa" xmlns:vellum="http://commcarehq.org/xforms/vellum">
	<h:head>
		<h:title>Close</h:title>
		<model>
			<instance>
				<data xmlns:jrm="http://dev.commcarehq.org/jr/xforms" xmlns="http://openrosa.org/formdesigner/5CCB1614-68B3-44C0-A166-D63AA7C1D4FB" uiVersion="1" version="1" name="Close">
					<welcome_message/>
					<close_confirmation/>
					<close_reason/>
				</data>
			</instance>
			<bind nodeset="/data/welcome_message"/>
			<bind nodeset="/data/close_confirmation"/>
			<bind nodeset="/data/close_reason" type="xsd:string" relevant="/data/close_confirmation = 'yes'"/>
			<itext>
				<translation lang="en" default="">
					<text id="welcome_message-label">
						<value>This is a case close form.  It lets you select a previously registered case and remove it from the phone. Its important to remove cases from the phone so that the user only sees the cases that they need to see.  However, all information collected about the case will still be stored on CommCareHQ.  

* You can add questions to collect information about why the case is being closed.
* Previously saved case properties have already been automatically loaded to this form, and can be updated and referenced in a similar fashion to the "Visit" form.

For more help, see the following Help Site Pages:

* [CommCare Forms](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Form+Builder)
* [Case Management Overview](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Case+Management).
* [Application Building Tutorials](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Application+Building+Tutorial+Series)

When you're ready to test your application, you can use the Try In CloudCare option on the form settings page, or [install it on a phone using our deploy manager](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Deploy+an+Application+on+CommCareHQ).</value>
						<value form="markdown">This is a case close form.  It lets you select a previously registered case and remove it from the phone. Its important to remove cases from the phone so that the user only sees the cases that they need to see.  However, all information collected about the case will still be stored on CommCareHQ.  

* You can add questions to collect information about why the case is being closed.
* Previously saved case properties have already been automatically loaded to this form, and can be updated and referenced in a similar fashion to the "Visit" form.

For more help, see the following Help Site Pages:

* [CommCare Forms](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Form+Builder)
* [Case Management Overview](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Case+Management).
* [Application Building Tutorials](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Application+Building+Tutorial+Series)

When you're ready to test your application, you can use the Try In CloudCare option on the form settings page, or [install it on a phone using our deploy manager](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Deploy+an+Application+on+CommCareHQ).</value>
					</text>
					<text id="close_confirmation-label">
						<value>Confirm case close. Choose "Yes" to confirm that you want to close this case.</value>
					</text>
					<text id="close_confirmation-yes-label">
						<value>Yes</value>
					</text>
					<text id="close_confirmation-no-label">
						<value>No</value>
					</text>
					<text id="close_reason-label">
						<value>Close Reason</value>
					</text>
				</translation>
			</itext>
		</model>
	</h:head>
	<h:body>
		<trigger ref="/data/welcome_message" appearance="minimal">
			<label ref="jr:itext('welcome_message-label')"/>
		</trigger>
		<select1 ref="/data/close_confirmation">
			<label ref="jr:itext('close_confirmation-label')"/>
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('close_confirmation-yes-label')"/>
				<value>yes</value>
			</item>
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('close_confirmation-no-label')"/>
				<value>no</value>
			</item>
		</select1>
		<input ref="/data/close_reason">
			<label ref="jr:itext('close_reason-label')"/>
		</input>
	</h:body>
</h:html>
_attachments.45ea0dd8e021c24360307278c967a18a836110fb:
<h:html xmlns:h="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" xmlns:orx="http://openrosa.org/jr/xforms" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2002/xforms" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:jr="http://openrosa.org/javarosa" xmlns:vellum="http://commcarehq.org/xforms/vellum">
	<h:head>
		<h:title>Registration</h:title>
		<model>
			<instance>
				<data xmlns:jrm="http://dev.commcarehq.org/jr/xforms" xmlns="http://openrosa.org/formdesigner/11FAC65A-F2CD-427F-A870-CF126336AAB5" uiVersion="1" version="1" name="Registration">
					<welcome_message/>
					<name/>
					<sample_choice_question/>
					<sample_number_question/>
				</data>
			</instance>
			<bind nodeset="/data/welcome_message"/>
			<bind nodeset="/data/name" type="xsd:string" required="true()"/>
			<bind nodeset="/data/sample_choice_question"/>
			<bind nodeset="/data/sample_number_question" type="xsd:int"/>
			<itext>
				<translation lang="en" default="">
					<text id="welcome_message-label">
						<value>This is a registration form.  It adds new items (**Cases**) to track.  You can save some or all of the questions in this form to the case as **case properties**, which means you can refer to them in later forms, display them on the phone as a record, or use them to distinguish among cases.  

Add questions to this form using the toolbar above:

* You can add text, number, multiple choice, or other question types.  
* For multiple and single choice questions, use the circle button in the toolbar to add more choices.
* For a given question, set the Question ID to the name of your data variable and the Label to the text you want the user to see.

On the main form settings page, you can choose which of these questions you want to *save to the case* as case properties. These case properties will automatically be loaded into future forms for referencing in ways such as display logic and validation logic.

For more help, see the following Help Site Pages:

* [CommCare Forms](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Form+Builder)
* [Case Management Overview](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Case+Management).
* [Application Building Tutorials](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Application+Building+Tutorial+Series)

When you're ready to test your form, you can use the Try In CloudCare option on the main form page, or [install it on a phone using our deploy manager](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Deploy+an+Application+on+CommCareHQ).</value>
						<value form="markdown">This is a registration form.  It adds new items (**Cases**) to track.  You can save some or all of the questions in this form to the case as **case properties**, which means you can refer to them in later forms, display them on the phone as a record, or use them to distinguish among cases.  

Add questions to this form using the toolbar above:

* You can add text, number, multiple choice, or other question types.  
* For multiple and single choice questions, use the circle button in the toolbar to add more choices.
* For a given question, set the Question ID to the name of your data variable and the Label to the text you want the user to see.

On the main form settings page, you can choose which of these questions you want to *save to the case* as case properties.  These case properties will automatically be loaded into future forms for referencing in ways such as display logic and validation logic.

For more help, see the following Help Site Pages:

* [CommCare Forms](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Form+Builder)
* [Case Management Overview](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Case+Management).
* [Application Building Tutorials](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Application+Building+Tutorial+Series)

When you're ready to test your form, you can use the Try In CloudCare option on the main form page, or [install it on a phone using our deploy manager](https://confluence.dimagi.com/display/commcarepublic/Deploy+an+Application+on+CommCareHQ).</value>
					</text>
					<text id="name-label">
						<value>Name

**This question is configured to be the "name" of the case**</value>
						<value form="markdown">Name

**This question is configured to be the "name" of the case**</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_choice_question-label">
						<value>Sample Choice Question</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_choice_question-choice1-label">
						<value>Choice 1</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_choice_question-choice2-label">
						<value>Choice 2</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_choice_question-choice3-label">
						<value>Choice 3</value>
					</text>
					<text id="sample_number_question-label">
						<value>Sample Number Question</value>
					</text>
				</translation>
			</itext>
		</model>
	</h:head>
	<h:body>
		<trigger ref="/data/welcome_message" appearance="minimal">
			<label ref="jr:itext('welcome_message-label')"/>
		</trigger>
		<input ref="/data/name">
			<label ref="jr:itext('name-label')"/>
		</input>
		<select1 ref="/data/sample_choice_question">
			<label ref="jr:itext('sample_choice_question-label')"/>
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('sample_choice_question-choice1-label')"/>
				<value>choice1</value>
			</item>
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('sample_choice_question-choice2-label')"/>
				<value>choice2</value>
			</item>
			<item>
				<label ref="jr:itext('sample_choice_question-choice3-label')"/>
				<value>choice3</value>
			</item>
		</select1>
		<input ref="/data/sample_number_question">
			<label ref="jr:itext('sample_number_question-label')"/>
		</input>
	</h:body>
</h:html>
